events.name: Beijing HackSense
events.about:
NetEasy and MakeSense are partnering to organize the first HackSense, as part of the Non-profits VS Internet series of events, on Sunday December 18, in Beijing, 798. Inspired by the hackathons for good organized worldwide, the HackSense will bring together technology experts and social entrepreneurs with the objective to improve society. Therefore, if you are an engineer, a programmers, a technologist or a designer, join us to solve the challenges faced by local social enterprises and non-profits.

A few examples of projects you can be involved in: a mobile application to help raise healthy babies & improve the health of the migrant population (Healthy Baby SMS), a crowdsourcing platform to improve education in rural China (1KG), an online selling platform to trade products from disabled artists...

Key dates

  • Dec 18, HackSense kick-off: projects presentation & brainstorming
  • Dec 18-29, from home: team work on projects
  • Dec 29, Non-profits VS Internet Closing event: demo

Kick-off Details

  • Date: Sunday, Dec 18th
  • Time: 9h30 - 18h 
  • Venue: T SPACE, No.2 Jiuxianqiao R.d, Chaoyang Dst. 798 Art District, Beijing
  • Language: Chinese & English

The project teams will be coached by experienced mentors, and a special prize will be attributed to the best project during the closing event on December 29. The number of participants is limited, so make sure to register now at http://beijinghacksense.eventbrite.com/

Organizers

NetEasy is a provider of information and communication technology (ICT) cloud services to non-profit organizations.

MakeSense is a community-based platform which connects Social Entrepreneurs with ordinary individuals ready to take up their challenges. This is done both online, through a web application, and offline through innovative workshops and events.
